content:
• Thursday, May 9, 2013
  • ZGNX

    More on Zogenix (NASDAQ:ZGNX): Q1 misses on all counts. Net product revenues declined Y/Y,...

    More on Zogenix (NASDAQ:ZGNX): Q1 misses on all counts. Net product revenues declined Y/Y, driven by the increase to the return reserve and the resetting of health insurance co-pays and co-insurance at the beginning of the year, which slowed patient volumes to a greater degree than in previous years. Product gross margin was 40%, compared to 49% in Q112, due to higher cost per unit and a decrease in the net selling price. Shares -2.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:50 PM
  • IQV

    Quintiles (Q) finshed its IPO debut today in the green, with the company’s shares ending...

    Quintiles (Q) finshed its IPO debut today in the green, with the company’s shares ending the day at $42.11, up more than 5% from their initial offering price of $40. The company provides testing and diagnostic services to biopharmaceutical companies, and could see a boon to business with the implementation of President Obama’s health-care overhaul.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:39 PM
  • SNTS

    Santarus (NASDAQ:SNTS) announces a secondary offering of shares of its common stock. All shares...

    Santarus (NASDAQ:SNTS) announces a secondary offering of shares of its common stock. All shares will be offered by Cosmo Technologies. SNTS isn't selling any shares or receiving any proceeds from the offering. No details as to the actual size or terms of the offering were disclosed. Jefferies LLC is acting as the sole book-running manager. Shares -6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:16 PM

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:30 p.m.: UBNT +10%. UNIS +10%. MCP +7%. WIFI +7%. DAR +6%.

  • SQNM

    More on Sequenom (NASDAQ:SQNM): Q1 misses on a per share basis as losses increase, but meets...

    More on Sequenom (NASDAQ:SQNM): Q1 misses on a per share basis as losses increase, but meets revenue estimates. Total sales jumped 158% over the prior year, led by continued growth in diagnostic sales. Total cost of revenues increased, primarily due to the significant increase in its test volumes and costs to support increased testing capacity. Shares +5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:51 PM
  • UNIS

    Unilife (NASDAQ:UNIS): FQ3 EPS of -$0.12 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $685K. Shares +9.7% AH. (PR)

    Unilife (NASDAQ:UNIS): FQ3 EPS of -$0.12 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $685K. Shares +9.7% AH. (PR)

    51job (NASDAQ:JOBS): Q1 EPS of $0.67 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $61.2M beats by $0.1M. Shares...

    51job (NASDAQ:JOBS): Q1 EPS of $0.67 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $61.2M beats by $0.1M. Shares -4% AH. (PR)

  • MDRX

    More on Allscripts-Misys Healthcare (NASDAQ:MDRX): Q1 misses on both EPS and revenue. Net...

    More on Allscripts-Misys Healthcare (NASDAQ:MDRX): Q1 misses on both EPS and revenue. Net earnings swung to a surprise loss as its bottom line was hit by higher restructuring-related charges, plus acquisition-related impacts and other items. Gross margin fell to 38.7% from 42.7%. Shares -6.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:03 PM
  • DAR

    More on Darling International (NYSE:DAR): Q1 beats estimates across the board. Net sales rose by...

    More on Darling International (NYSE:DAR): Q1 beats estimates across the board. Net sales rose by 15% Y/Y, driven by higher finished product selling prices for proteins and bakery finished products. Higher raw material volumes in both the Rendering and Bakery Segments also contributed to the increase and helped to offset the decrease in fat prices year over year. Shares +5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM
  • MCPIQ

    More on Molycorp's (MCP) Q1 results: Says production ramp-up at Mountain Pass remains on...

    More on Molycorp's (MCP) Q1 results: Says production ramp-up at Mountain Pass remains on course, and increasing production is allowing production for end-use customers and providing greater feedstock to downstream, value-added processing facilities. Sees signs of a return to more normal demand levels as the year progresses. Continues to expect H1 results weaker than H2 2012. Shares +8.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM | 1 Comment
  • WIFI

    Boingo Wireless (NASDAQ:WIFI): Q1 EPS of -$0.03 in-line. Revenue of $23.1M beats by $0.96M....

    Boingo Wireless (NASDAQ:WIFI): Q1 EPS of -$0.03 in-line. Revenue of $23.1M beats by $0.96M. Shares +7.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • CALL

    In tandem with its Q1 results, magicJack (NASDAQ:CALL) announces Peter Russo is being replaced...

    In tandem with its Q1 results, magicJack (NASDAQ:CALL) announces Peter Russo is being replaced as CFO by Jose Gordo, who prior to recently joining the company co-founded an investment firm (but apparently left after two years). Russo will remain with the company as a consultant. magicJack is guiding for 2013 revenue of $155M-$160M, which compares with 2012 revenue of $158.4M - no consensus forecast exists. No proceeds were generated from put sales during Q1, but a $1M fair value loss was recorded on put option holdings. Shares -5.4% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM | 3 Comments
  • TCAP-OLD

    Triangle Capital (TCAP-OLD -5%) took a big tumble following the earnings call as management was...

    Triangle Capital (TCAP-OLD -5%) took a big tumble following the earnings call as management was pressed (transcript) on what was going on in the market that led to such little portfolio activity in Q1. "There were deals that we hoped to get that we didn't get ... it was definitely slower activity," says CIO Brent Burgess, quickly adding he sees pipelines building and expects a busy Q3 and Q4 (Q2 not mentioned).

     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM

    Alimera Sciences (NASDAQ:ALIM): Q1 EPS of -$0.44 misses by $0.18. Shares +5.3% AH. (PR)

    Sotheby's (NYSE:BID): Q1 EPS of -$0.33 misses by $0.21. Revenue of $101.7M (-3% Y/Y) misses by $15.2M. Shares -8.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • BKNG

    More on Priceline (PCLN): Total gross bookings rose 36.4% Y/Y in Q1 to improve over last...

    More on Priceline (PCLN): Total gross bookings rose 36.4% Y/Y in Q1 to improve over last quarter's pace of growth with international bookings strong again. Q2 EPS guidance of $8.87-$9.45 is below the consensus estimates of $9.58, but gross bookings are expected to increase 30% to 37% in Q2 to help revenue improve 15% to 22% during the period. PCLN -2.2% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • AIRM

    Air Methods (NASDAQ:AIRM): Q1 EPS of -$0.15 misses by $0.10. Revenue of $179.2M (-6% Y/Y) misses...

    Air Methods (NASDAQ:AIRM): Q1 EPS of -$0.15 misses by $0.10. Revenue of $179.2M (-6% Y/Y) misses by $14.43M. Shares -4.8% AH. (PR)

    Tangoe (OTC:TNGO): Q1 EPS of $0.15 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $44.9M (+31% Y/Y) beats by $0.73M....

    Tangoe (OTC:TNGO): Q1 EPS of $0.15 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $44.9M (+31% Y/Y) beats by $0.73M. Shares -7% AH. (PR)

    PDL Biopharma (NASDAQ:PDLI): Q1 EPS of $0.36 in line. Revenue of $91.8M (+19% Y/Y) beats by $110K. (PR). Shares +2% AH.

    ExactTarget (NYSE:ET-OLD): Q1 EPS of -$0.08 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $89.4M (+40% Y/Y) beats...

    ExactTarget (NYSE:ET-OLD): Q1 EPS of -$0.08 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $89.4M (+40% Y/Y) beats by $1.42M. Shares +2% AH. (PR)

    Ubiquiti Networks (NASDAQ:UBNT): Q1 EPS of $0.24 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $83.2M beats by...

    magicJack VocalTec (NASDAQ:CALL): Q1 EPS of $0.78. Revenue of $36.9M. Shares +2.3% AH. (PR)

  • GPS

    Gap (NYSE:GPS) says same-store sales rose 7% in April, led by a 8% gain for Gap Global and 9%...

    Gap (NYSE:GPS) says same-store sales rose 7% in April, led by a 8% gain for Gap Global and 9% Old Navy Global. Q1 EPS is forecast to come in at $0.68-$0.69 vs. $0.56 consensus. GPS +5.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM | 1 Comment
  • MDRX

    Allscripts-Misys Healthcare (NASDAQ:MDRX): Q1 EPS of $0.09 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $348M...

    Allscripts-Misys Healthcare (NASDAQ:MDRX): Q1 EPS of $0.09 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $348M misses by $20.11M. Shares -2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • CDE

    Coeur d'Alene's (CDE -5.3%) Q1 net income tripled but fell short of estimates, sending shares...

    Coeur d'Alene's (CDE -5.3%) Q1 net income tripled but fell short of estimates, sending shares lower. Average realized prices fell 7% per silver oz. and 4% per gold oz. Silver output slid 22% to 3.8M oz. due to lower-grade ore mined at Palmarejo in Mexico, CDE's biggest mine by production. Expects operating costs per silver oz. to increase to $9.50-$10.50 this year from $8.00-$9.00 it had forecast earlier.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • TVIAQ

    Solazyme (SZYM +9%) soars after reporting a smaller-than-expected Q1 loss and the biofuels...

    Solazyme (SZYM +9%) soars after reporting a smaller-than-expected Q1 loss and the biofuels company says it's on track to begin commercial production by early 2014 and reach full capacity in 12-18 months - "unquestionably the first player in the algae arena to claim such a feat," praises Raymond James' Pavel Molchanov.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM | 4 Comments
  • HLF

    Charles Gasparino says that Third Point's Dan Loeb was apparently cracking jokes about Bill...

    Charles Gasparino says that Third Point's Dan Loeb was apparently cracking jokes about Bill Ackman and his research behind Herbalife (HLF +1.8%) during a SALT 2013 presentation today. Loeb said the market essentially overreacted to the "Ack-attack" given cash flow and other metrics, and that Carl Icahn gave him confidence in taking a long position in the stock, which he has since gotten out of.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM | 12 Comments
  • TCPTF

    Thompson Creek Metals (TC +17%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold with a $5 price target at BB&T...

    Thompson Creek Metals (TC +17%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold with a $5 price target at BB&T Capital after solid Q1 results, noting TC should start generating meaningful free cash flow as capex winds down and copper/gold sales ramp up, providing an opportunity to de-lever its balance sheet. While startup risks remain, the firm likes TC's inexpensive valuation and modest target multiples.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM

  • The dollar (UUP +1%) is soaring across the board (not just against the yen, where it's now...

    The dollar (UUP +1%) is soaring across the board (not just against the yen, where it's now spiked through ¥100 to ¥100.56). The greenback is threatening parity vs. the aussie (FXA -1.1%) for the first time since last summer, and the euro (FXE -1.1%), swissie (FXF -1.4%), loonie (FXC -0.5%), and pound (FXB -0.6%) are seeing sizable declines as well. Commodities? Red. Gold (GLD -1.1%), Silver (SLV -1.2%), Oil (USO -0.6%), Copper (JJC -0.8%).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:06 PM | 5 Comments
  • VRML

    Vermillion (VRML +39%) soars today after reporting earlier that Oracle Investment Management and...

    Vermillion (VRML +39%) soars today after reporting earlier that Oracle Investment Management and other investors will make an initial investment of $13.2M by purchasing 8M shares of the company's stock.  VRML will also issue 12.5M warrants with a strike price of $1.46 for $18.3M in proceeds, bringing the total gross investment to $31.5M. Proceeds will be used to increase test sales and improve reimbursement for OVA1, as well as to expand into new markets and advance next-generation ovarian cancer diagnostic tests.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM
  • APA

    Investors who had been worried that Apache (APA +4.6%) was taking a hands-off approach to its...

    Investors who had been worried that Apache (APA +4.6%) was taking a hands-off approach to its share price cheer the news it would seek to sell $4B in assets this year. APA declines to say which assets are on its sales list, but the news, plus a share buyback plan, helped turn attention away from a weak Q1, impacted in part by declining output in Egypt.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM | 1 Comment
  • GRPN

    Positive sell-side commentary helps Groupon (GRPN +11.3%) remain sharply higher following its Q1...

    Positive sell-side commentary helps Groupon (GRPN +11.3%) remain sharply higher following its Q1 revenue beat, which featured Q/Q gross margin and take rate improvements. "Groupon's [daily deals] leadership position will yield a growing, albeit slow, business in 2014 and 2015," says Gene Munster, whose pre-earnings predictions (I, II) were off the mark for both Q4 and Q1. Strong mobile numbers are also encouraging bulls: 45% of Q1 North American transactions took place via a mobile device, up from less than 40% in Q4. The number of customers to have bought a Groupon in the trailing 12 months rose by 700K Q/Q to 41.7M. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM | 1 Comment
  • DNDN

    Dendreon (DNDN -14.4%) retests its lows for the day as the Street begins to weigh in on its Q1...

    Dendreon (DNDN -14.4%) retests its lows for the day as the Street begins to weigh in on its Q1 miss and dismal Provenge sales numbers. Stifel Nicolaus cuts the shares to Sell, calling Provenge "hopeless," and saying the company is likely to burn through its cash long before it ever reaches breakeven, and faces the possiblity of bankruptcy before the end of FY14. Roth Capital also downgrades the stock to Sell as well.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • BSX

    Boston Scientific (BSX +5%) hits a new 52-week high after reporting follow-up data from its...

    Boston Scientific (BSX +5%) hits a new 52-week high after reporting follow-up data from its Protect AF clinical trial demonstrating that its Watchman Left Atrial Appendage Closure device was statistically superior to Bristol-Myers (NYSE:BMY) Warfarin in preventing cardiovascular death, strokes and systemic embolization.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM | 1 Comment
  • LULU

    Shares of Lululemon (LULU +7.7%) shoot higher to clear $80 for the first time. There isn't any...

    Shares of Lululemon (LULU +7.7%) shoot higher to clear $80 for the first time. There isn't any dramatic news out on the company, but the force of gravity seems to be in play as other favorite short targets such as Tesla Motors, Green Mountain Coffee Roasters, and SodaStream are all putting in their own substantial rallies. Insider Monkey notes more hedge funds have bought into the retailer in recent months - led by a Lone Pine Capital's $368M position,
     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • ASRT

    Depomed (DEPO -6.3%) slides after missing top and bottom line estimates. Sales of Gralise came...

    Depomed (DEPO -6.3%) slides after missing top and bottom line estimates. Sales of Gralise came in at $6.1M as prescription growth for the shingles pain medication fell to 7% during the period. Meanwhile, sales of Zipsor fell to $3M from $4.9M in the previous two quarters. Sales of both products were affected by price increases and wholesaler inventory reductions. SA contributor and analyst Jason Napodano (who was on the CC) calls the stock "cheap" in a comprehensive rundown of the quarter. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM
  • BA

    Boeing (BA +0.8%) rolls out the first 787 Dreamliner to be produced at its new seven-per-month...

    Boeing (BA +0.8%) rolls out the first 787 Dreamliner to be produced at its new seven-per-month rate, with a targeted monthly output of 10 by year's end. The latest aircraft is due to be delivered to British Airways. To date, 50 Dreamliners have been delivered to eight airlines. The program has more than 800 unfilled orders with 58 customers worldwide. Separately, SocGen has upped the shares to a Hold today as well.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • FXY

    The yen (FXY -0.8%) has weakened sharply in the last few minutes, with the dollar making another...

    The yen (FXY -0.8%) has weakened sharply in the last few minutes, with the dollar making another run at ¥100, currently buying ¥99.80. A move into triple digits would be the first time that high for the greenback in 4 years.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM | 4 Comments
  • HNSN

    Hansen Medical's (HNSN -10.5%) weak Q1 results trigger a couple of downgrades today, as...

    Hansen Medical's (HNSN -10.5%) weak Q1 results trigger a couple of downgrades today, as Ladenburg Thalmann and Jefferies both cut the shares to Neutral. In a note to clients, Jefferies points out the company continues to face challenges commercializing its Magellan vascular system, with only three systems shipped during Q1. With multiple hospitals evaluating the system, but none making purchase commitments, Jefferies believes concerns regarding hospital investment returns and the capital purchasing environment are likely to continue to weigh heavily on the shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM
  • FTR

    Frontier (FTR -1.6%) ticks lower as two rural telco peers head in opposite directions following...

    Frontier (FTR -1.6%) ticks lower as two rural telco peers head in opposite directions following their Q1 reports. CenturyLink (CTL +1.9%) is rallying in response to an EPS beat and reaffirmed free cash flow guidance, and Windstream (WIN -4.2%) is selling off due to a revenue/EPS miss caused by ongoing wholesale and (to a lesser extent) consumer weakness. Also: Highfields Capital's Jonathan Jacobson made a bear case for AT&T today featuring arguments - slumping wireline revenue and a potentially unsustainable dividend yield - that are often levied against rural telcos. (transcripts: CenturyLink, Windstream) (Frontier Q1: I, II)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM
  • HSP

    Hospira (HSP +2%) sues B. Braun for allegedly infringing upon the former's patents for...

    Hospira (HSP +2%) sues B. Braun for allegedly infringing upon the former's patents for drug-infusion pump technology. HSP is seeking unspecified damages for lost profits and legal fees. (Bloomberg)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM
  • MNST

    A lawsuit filed against Monster Beverage (MNST -7%) by the city of San Francisco might not...

    A lawsuit filed against Monster Beverage (MNST -7%) by the city of San Francisco might not amount to a hill of beans in the long run, but that doesn't mean legal expenses won't take a bite out of the firm's profits. General and administrative expenses as a percentage of sales rose over 300 bps during Q1 to 11.8% with execs acknowledging during the firm's earnings call that legal bills were growing. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM

  • Syntha Pharmaceuticals (SNTA, +12.8%) bounces back somewhat from a 26.8% decline over the past...

    Syntha Pharmaceuticals (SNTA, +12.8%) bounces back somewhat from a 26.8% decline over the past two sessions, following the drug-maker's announcement that Sumant Ramachandra had resigned as president of its R&D operations for personal reasons after less than two months on the job. The move triggered a downgrade to Market Perform at BMO Capital, noting that the sudden resignation ahead of the upcoming ASCO meeting suggests a "less than amicable separation."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM
  • EGL

    What sequester? A subsidiary of Engility Holdings (EGL -1.4%) wins a $400M contract to support...

    What sequester? A subsidiary of Engility Holdings (EGL -1.4%) wins a $400M contract to support the U.S. government's clean-energy efforts is several Middle-East countries. With the news perhaps already priced in, the stock is seeing little benefit today. Shares +18% since last summer's IPO.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM
  • P

    Pandora (P +7.2%) surges to new 52-week highs after announcing it has hired music industry...

    Pandora (P +7.2%) surges to new 52-week highs after announcing it has hired music industry vet/Billboard publisher Tommy Page to be its VP of Artist and Brand Partnerships. Pandora adds Page's "immediate focus is to expand artist development programming," both via branded content and live events. A stronger original content push could help Pandora better differentiate itself in a hotly competitive Web/mobile music market. Shares have more than won back the losses they saw in response to disappointing April audience metrics.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM | 6 Comments
  • TNK

    Teekay Tankers (TNK -7.2%) is sharply lower after reporting Q1 results below analyst estimates....

    Teekay Tankers (TNK -7.2%) is sharply lower after reporting Q1 results below analyst estimates. The company was hurt by lower demand from OPEC nations for large crude transport of exported oil.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM
  • HNSN

    More on Hansen Medical's (HNSN -10.9%) Q1: The company extends its streak of consecutive...

    More on Hansen Medical's (HNSN -10.9%) Q1: The company extends its streak of consecutive quarters with procedure growth to seven, but the pace slows to 3% sequentially from sequential procedure growth of 15% in Q4 (Y/Y growth was 23% however). Catheter sales rose 3% Y/Y but fell 30% sequentially while costs and expenses were flat Y/Y. The company also says it will issue $4.25M in shares to cover its part of a class action lawsuit settlement. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • TRMD-OLD

    Midday top 10 gainers: TRMD-OLD +94%. OPTT +42%. VRML +32%. OTC:AFFY +28%. TSLA +27%. XOMA +26%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: TRMD-OLD +94%. OPTT +42%. VRML +32%. OTC:AFFY +28%. TSLA +27%. XOMA +26%. GMCR +25%. CTRP +24%. OWW +23%. CHYR +19%.
    Midday top 10 losers: LPSN -34%. PZZI -33%. RAX -26%. KEM -25%. NSYS -23%. MNOV -22%. WG -20%. GV -18%. ORBT -16%. OFIX -16%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • RAX

    Four downgrades are levied on Rackspace (RAX -26.3%) following yesterday's Q1 revenue miss,...

    Four downgrades are levied on Rackspace (RAX -26.3%) following yesterday's Q1 revenue miss, accompanied by worrying business metrics. Slowing growth and a slumping EBITDA margin (due to price cuts) are problems that will get worse as Microsoft and Google ramp their cloud offerings, argues CLSA, which has cut shares to Sell. The firm adds checks indicate "mid-tier to large firms" are increasingly migrating from hosting to cloud services, and expects OpenStack to be immaterial to RAX's bottom line for the next 1-2 years. Stephens, making a contrarian upgrade to Overweight, thinks "new contract wins are on the horizon," as Rackspace targets enterprises. EQIX -2.2%. COR -4.2%. INXN -3.3%. VMW -2.5%. (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • ALR

    Alere (ALR +2.4%) trades up today after the near-patient diagnosis, monitoring and health...

    Alere (ALR +2.4%) trades up today after the near-patient diagnosis, monitoring and health management services provider posted Q1 earnings that beat across the board. Net revenue rose 10% Y/Y, on higher sales in its professional diagnostic and triage segments. North American influenza sales jumped to $34.3M during the quarter, up from $6.6M in Q112.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • SUNEQ

    MEMC (WFR -5.6%) slumps following a mixed Q1 report and equally mixed guidance. Though revenue...

    MEMC (WFR -5.6%) slumps following a mixed Q1 report and equally mixed guidance. Though revenue beat estimates thanks to 45MW of solar system sales (above guidance of 10MW-38MW), EPS missed due to a mix shift towards low-price EPC solar projects - this contributed to a 680 bps Q/Q drop in gross margin to 11.2%. MEMC's 2013 chip materials guidance was raised to $960M-$1B from $940M-$990M, but Q2 revenue is only expected to rise to $235M-$245M from Q1's $230M. Likewise, 2013 solar guidance is raised by 10MW to 430MW-500MW, but Q2 guidance is for only 29MW-54MW. This makes a consensus for 36% Q/Q rev. growth appear excessive. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM
  • ZLTQ

    Zeltiq Aesthetics (ZLTQ +5.5%) gets another boost today, this time from Maxim, who initiated the...

    Zeltiq Aesthetics (ZLTQ +5.5%) gets another boost today, this time from Maxim, who initiated the stock with a Buy rating and a price target of $7 a share - nearly a 60% return from current levels. The stock's been riding high the past two trading sessions, up over 13% on no significant news, with today's volume much heavier than average.
